Description: Manages authorization settings in Azure AD

Controls.Name: allowedToUseSSPR
Controls.Description: Designates whether users in this directory can reset their own password.

Controls.Name: blockMsolPowerShell
Controls.Description: Specifies whether the user-based access to the legacy service endpoint used by MSOL PowerShell is blocked or not. This does not affect Azure AD Connect or Microsoft Graph.

Controls.Name: enabledPreviewFeatures
Controls.Description: Manages access of (private) preview features in tenant.

Controls.Name: allowInvitesFrom
Controls.Description: Manages controls who can invite guests to your directory to collaborate on resources secured by your Azure AD, such as SharePoint sites or Azure resources.

Controls.Name: allowedToSignUpEmailBasedSubscriptions
Controls.Description: Indicates whether users can sign up for email based subscriptions.

Controls.Name: allowEmailVerifiedUsersToJoinOrganization
Controls.Description: Indicates whether a user can join the tenant by email validation.

Controls.Name: guestUserRoleId
Controls.Description: Represents role templateId for the role that should be granted to guest user.

Controls.Name: permissionGrantPolicyIdsAssignedToDefaultUserRole
Controls.DisplayName: User consent policy assigned for applications
Controls.Description: Defines if user consent to apps is allowed, and if it is, which app consent policy (permissionGrantPolicy) governs the permissions.

Controls.Name: allowUserConsentForRiskyApps
Controls.Description: Indicates whether user consent for risky apps is allowed. For example, consent requests for newly registered multi-tenant apps that are not publisher verified and require non-basic permissions are considered risky.

Controls.Name: allowedToCreateApps
Controls.DisplayName: Default User Role Permissions - Allowed to create Apps
Controls.Description: Controls if non-admin users may register custom-developed applications for use within this directory.

Controls.Name: allowedToCreateSecurityGroups
Controls.DisplayName: Default User Role Permissions - Allowed to create Security Groups
Controls.Description: Defines default permission of user to create security groups in Azure portals, API or PowerShell. Global administrators and user administrators can still create security groups.

Controls.Name: allowedToCreateTenants
Controls.DisplayName: Default User Role Permissions - Allowed to create Tenants
Controls.Description: Restricts the creation of Azure AD tenants to the global administrator or tenant creator roles. Anyone who creates a tenant will become the global administrator for that tenant.

Controls.Name: allowedToReadBitlockerKeysForOwnedDevice
Controls.DisplayName: Default User Role Permissions - Allowed to read BitLocker Keys for Owned Devices
Controls.Description: Controls default access for members (end-user) to read BitLocker Keys of company-owned devices (device assigned to user).

Controls.Name: allowedToReadOtherUsers
Controls.DisplayName: Default User Role Permissions - Allowed to read other users
Controls.Description: Prevents all non-admins from reading user information from the directory. This flag doesn't prevent reading user information in other Microsoft services like Exchange Online.

Description: Define the consent configurations that can be used to customize the tenant-wide and object-specific restrictions and allowed behavior

Controls.Name: EnableGroupSpecificConsent
Controls.DisplayName: Group owner consent for apps accessing data
Controls.Description: Group and team owners can authorize applications, such as applications published by third-party vendors, to access your organization's data associated with a group. For example, a team owner in Microsoft Teams can allow an app to read all Teams messages in the team, or list the basic profile of a group's members.

Controls.Name: ConstrainGroupSpecificConsentToMembersOfGroupId
Controls.DisplayName: Group owner consent for apps accessing data - Restricted to selected group owners
Controls.Description: Only selected group owners can allow applications to access data for the groups they own.

Controls.Name: EnableAdminConsentRequests
Controls.Description: If this option is set to enabled, then users request admin consent to any app that requires access to data they do not have the permission to grant. If this option is set to disabled, then users must contact their admin to request to consent in order to use the apps they need.

Description: Define the password protection and Smart Lockout configurations that can be used to customize the tenant-wide and object-specific restrictions and allowed behavior

Controls.Name: BannedPasswordCheckOnPremisesMode
Controls.Description: If set to Enforce, users will be prevented from setting banned passwords and the attempt will be logged. If set to Audit, the attempt will only be logged.

Controls.Name: EnableBannedPasswordCheckOnPremises
Controls.DisplayName: Password Protection - Enable password protection on Windows Server Active Directory
Controls.Description: If set to Yes, password protection is turned on for Active Directory domain controllers when the appropriate agent is installed.

Controls.Name: EnableBannedPasswordCheck
Controls.Description: When enabled, the words in the list below are used in the banned password system to prevent easy-to-guess passwords.

Controls.Name: BannedPasswordList
Controls.DisplayName: Password Protection - Custom banned password list
Controls.Description: A list of words, one per line, to prevent your users from using in their passwords. You should include words specific to your organization, such as your products, trademarks, industries, local cities and towns, and local sports teams. Your list can contain up to 1000 words. These are case insensitive, and common character substitutions (o for 0, etc) are automatically considered.

Controls.Name: LockoutDurationInSeconds
Controls.DisplayName: Smart Lockout - Lockout duration in seconds
Controls.Description: The minimum length in seconds of each lockout. If an account locks repeatedly, this duration increases.

Controls.Name: LockoutThreshold
Controls.Description: How many failed sign-ins are allowed on an account before its first lockout. If the first sign-in after a lockout also fails, the account locks out again.

ControlName: Default Settings - Classification and M365 Groups
Description: Define group configurations that can be used to customize the tenant-wide and object-specific restrictions and allowed behavior

Controls.Name: NewUnifiedGroupWritebackDefault
Controls.DisplayName: Default writeback setting for newly created Microsoft 365 groups
Controls.Description: If the original version of group write-back is already enabled and in use in your environment, all your Microsoft 365 groups have already been written back to Active Directory. Instead of disabling all Microsoft 365 groups, review any use of the previously written-back groups. Disable only those that are no longer needed in on-premises Active Directory.

Controls.Name: EnableMIPLabels
Controls.DisplayName: Microsoft Information Protection (MIP) Sensitivity labels to Microsoft 365 groups
Controls.Description: Enables to apply published labels to groups

Controls.Name: CustomBlockedWordsList
Controls.DisplayName: M365 groups naming convention - Custom blocked words list
Controls.Description: Comma-separated string of phrases that users will not be permitted to use in group names or aliases.

Controls.Name: EnableMSStandardBlockedWords
Controls.DisplayName: M365 groups naming convention - Microsoft Standard List of blocked words (deprecated)
Controls.Description: Deprecated. Do not use!

Controls.Name: ClassificationDescriptions
Controls.DisplayName: M365 groups naming convention - Classification descriptions
Controls.Description: A comma-delimited list of classification descriptions. This setting does not apply when EnableMIPLabels == True. Character limit for property ClassificationDescriptions is 300, and commas can't be escaped.

Controls.Name: DefaultClassification
Controls.DisplayName: M365 groups naming convention - Default classification
Controls.Description: The classification that is to be used as the default classification for a group if none was specified. This setting does not apply when EnableMIPLabels == True.

Controls.Name: PrefixSuffixNamingRequirement
Controls.DisplayName: M365 groups naming convention - prefix/suffix naming requirement
Controls.Description: String of a maximum length of 64 characters that defines the naming convention configured for Microsoft 365 groups.

Controls.Name: AllowGuestsToBeGroupOwner
Controls.DisplayName: M365 groups - Allow Guests to become Group Owner
Controls.Description: Indicating whether or not a guest user can be an owner of groups

Controls.Name: AllowGuestsToAccessGroups
Controls.DisplayName: M365 groups - Allow Guests to have access to groups content
Controls.Description: Indicating whether or not a guest user can have access to Microsoft 365 groups content. This setting does not require an Azure Active Directory Premium P1 license.

Controls.Name: GuestUsageGuidelinesUrl
Controls.DisplayName: M365 groups - Guest usage guidelines URL
Controls.Description: URL of a link to the guest usage guidelines which will be shown in external sharing e-mails. Link should be public available.

Controls.Name: EnableGroupCreation
Controls.DisplayName: M365 groups - Enable Group creation for members
Controls.Description: The flag indicating whether Microsoft 365 group creation is allowed in the directory by non-admin users. This setting does not require an Azure Active Directory Premium P1 license.

Controls.Name: GroupCreationAllowedGroupId
Controls.Description: GUID of the security group for which the members are allowed to create Microsoft 365 groups even when EnableGroupCreation == false.

Controls.Name: AllowToAddGuests
Controls.DisplayName: M365 groups - Allow to add Guests
Controls.Description: A boolean indicating whether or not is allowed to add guests to this directory. This setting may be overridden and become read-only if EnableMIPLabels is set to True and a guest policy is associated with the sensitivity label assigned to the group. If the AllowToAddGuests setting is set to False at the organization level, any AllowToAddGuests setting at the group level is ignored. If you want to enable guest access for only a few groups, you must set AllowToAddGuests to be true at the organization level, and then selectively disable it for specific groups.

Controls.Name: ClassificationList
Controls.Description: A comma-delimited list of valid classification values that can be applied to Microsoft 365 groups. This setting does not apply when EnableMIPLabels == True.

Description: Control the idle timeout for web sessions for applications that support activity-based timeout functionality

Controls.Name: WebSessionIdleTimeout
Controls.Description: Inactivity timeout is being enforced by this setting. You will be signed out after the configured time of inactivity.

Description: Controls whether external users can leave an Azure AD tenant via self-service controls

Controls.Name: allowExternalIdentitiesToLeave
Controls.Description: Allow external users to remove themselves from your organization

Controls.Name: allowDeletedIdentitiesDataRemoval
Controls.Description: Microsoft Docs describes this setting as: Reserved for future use.

Description: Defines a rollout and pilot feature before enabling for entire organization

Controls.Name: featureRolloutPolicy
Controls.Description: Policy helps tenant administrators to pilot features of Azure AD with a specific group before enabling features for entire organization

Description: Define configuration settings and users or groups that are enabled to use Authenticator App

Controls.Name: state
Controls.Description: Whether the Authenticator App is enabled in the tenant.

Controls.Name: isSoftwareOathEnabled
Controls.DisplayName: Allow use of Microsoft Authenticator OTP
Controls.Description: Defines if users can use the OTP code generated by the Authenticator App.

Controls.Name: numberMatchingRequiredState
Controls.DisplayName: Require number matching for push notifications
Controls.Description: Defines if number matching is required for MFA notifications.

Controls.Name: numberMatchingRequiredStateIncluded
Controls.DisplayName: Included users/groups of number matching for push notifications
Controls.Description: Object Id or scope of users which will be showing number matching in the Authenticator App.

Controls.Name: numberMatchingRequiredStateExcluded
Controls.DisplayName: Excluded users/groups of number matching for push notifications
Controls.Description: Object Id or scope of users which be able excluded from showing number matching in the Authenticator App.

Controls.Name: displayAppInformationRequiredState
Controls.DisplayName: Show application name in push and passwordless notifications
Controls.Description: Determines whether the user's Authenticator app will show them the client app they are signing into.

Controls.Name: displayAppInformationRequiredStateIncluded
Controls.DisplayName: Included users/groups to show application name in push and passwordless notifications
Controls.Description: Object Id or scope of users which will be showing app information in the Authenticator App.

Controls.Name: displayAppInformationRequiredStateExcluded
Controls.DisplayName: Excluded users/groups to show application name in push and passwordless notifications
Controls.Description: Object Id or scope of users which will be excluded from showing app information in the Authenticator App.

Controls.Name: displayLocationInformationRequiredState
Controls.DisplayName: Show geographic location in push and passwordless notifications
Controls.Description: Determines whether the user's Authenticator app will show them the geographic location of where the authentication request originated from.

Controls.Name: displayLocationInformationRequiredStateIncluded
Controls.DisplayName: Included users/groups to show geographic location in push and passwordless notifications
Controls.Description: Object Id or scope of users which will be showing geographic location in the Authenticator App.

Controls.Name: displayLocationInformationRequiredExcluded
Controls.DisplayName: Excluded users/groups to show geographic location in push and passwordless notifications
Controls.Description: Object Id or scope of users which are excluded from showing geographic location in the Authenticator App.

Controls.Name: includeTargets
Controls.DisplayName: Included users/groups from using security keys
Controls.Description: Object Id or scope of users which will be able to use the Microsoft Authenticator App.

Controls.Name: includeTargetsAuthenticationMode
Controls.Description: Determines which types of notifications can be used for sign-in. Possible values are: any, deviceBasedPush (passwordless only), push.

Controls.Name: includeTargetsRegistrationRequired
Controls.Description: Determines whether the user is enforced to register the Microsoft Authenticator App.

Controls.Name: excludeTargets
Controls.DisplayName: Excluded users/groups from using security keys
Controls.Description: Object Id or scope of users which will be excluded to use the Microsoft Authenticator App.

Description: Define configuration settings and users or groups that are enabled to use FIDO2 security keys

Controls.Name: state
Controls.Description: Whether the FIDO2 security keys is enabled in the tenant.

Controls.Name: isSelfServiceRegistrationAllowed
Controls.Description: Allows users to register a FIDO key through the MySecurityInfo portal, even if enabled by Authentication Methods policy.

Controls.Name: isAttestationEnforced
Controls.Description: Requires the FIDO security key metadata to be published and verified with the FIDO Alliance Metadata Service, and also pass Microsofts additional set of validation testing.

Controls.Name: keyRestrictions.isEnforced
Controls.Description: Manages if registration of FIDO2 keys should be restricted.

Controls.Name: keyRestrictions.aaGuids
Controls.Description: You can work with your Security key provider to determine the AAGuids of their devices for allowing or blocking usage.

Controls.Name: keyRestrictions.enforcementType
Controls.Description: Defines if list of AADGUID will be used to allow or block registration.

Controls.Name: includeTargets
Controls.DisplayName: Included users/groups from using security keys
Controls.Description: Object Id or scope of users which will be able to use FIDO2 security keys.

Controls.Name: includeTargetsRegistrationRequired
Controls.Description: Determines whether the user is enforced to register the authentication method.

Controls.Name: excludeTargets
Controls.DisplayName: Excluded users/groups from using security keys
Controls.Description: Object Id or scope of users which will be excluded to use FIDO2 security keys.

Description: Define configuration settings and users or groups that are enabled to use Temporary Access Pass

Controls.Name: state
Controls.Description: Whether the Temporary Access Pass is enabled in the tenant.

Controls.Name: isUsableOnce
Controls.Description: Determines whether the pass is limited to a one-time use.

Controls.Name: defaultLifetimeInMinutes
Controls.Description: Default lifetime in minutes for creating a new Temporary Access Pass.

Controls.Name: defaultLength
Controls.Description: Default length in characters of a Temporary Access Pass object. Must be between 8 and 48 characters.

Controls.Name: minimumLifetimeInMinutes
Controls.Description: Minimum lifetime in minutes for any Temporary Access Pass created in the tenant. Value can be between 10 and 43200 minutes (equivalent to 30 days).

Controls.Name: maximumLifetimeInMinutes
Controls.Description: Maximum lifetime in minutes for any Temporary Access Pass created in the tenant. Value can be between 10 and 43200 minutes (equivalent to 30 days).

Controls.Name: includeTargets
Controls.DisplayName: Included users/groups from Temporary Access Pass
Controls.Description: Object Id or scope of users which will be able to use Temporary Access Pass.

Controls.Name: includeTargetsRegistrationRequired
Controls.Description: N/A

Controls.Name: excludeTargets
Controls.DisplayName: Excluded users/group from Temporary Access Pass
Controls.Description: Object Id or scope of users which will be excluded to use Temporary Access Pass.

ControlName: Authentication Method - Third-party software OATH tokens
Description: Define configuration settings and users or groups that are enabled to use software OATH token

Controls.Name: state
Controls.Description: Whether the Third-party software OATH token is enabled in the tenant.

Controls.Name: includeTargets
Controls.Description: Object Id or scope of users which will be able to use OATH token.

Controls.Name: includeTargetsRegistrationRequired
Controls.Description: Determines whether the user is enforced to register the authentication method.

Controls.Name: excludeTargets
Controls.Description: Object Id or scope of users which will be excluded to use OATH token.

Description: Define configuration settings and users or groups that are enabled to use email address registered to a user. For members of a tenant, email OTP is usable only for Self-Service Password Recovery. It may also be configured to be used for sign-in by guest users.

Controls.Name: state
Controls.Description: Whether Email OTP is enabled in the tenant.

Controls.Name: allowExternalIdToUseEmailOtp
Controls.DisplayName: Allow external users to use email OTP
Controls.Description: Determines whether email one-time password is usable by external users for authentication. Tenants in the default state who did not use public preview will automatically have email OTP enabled beginning in March 2021.

Controls.Name: includeTargets
Controls.Description: Object Id or scope of users which will be able to use Email OTP.

Controls.Name: includeTargetsRegistrationRequired
Controls.Description: N/A

Controls.Name: excludeTargets
Controls.Description: Object Id or scope of users which will be excluded to use Email OTP.

Description: Define configuration settings and users or groups that are enabled to use voice call for authentication. Voice call is not usable as a first-factor authentication method.

Controls.Name: state
Controls.Description: Whether the Voice call is enabled in the tenant.

Controls.Name: isOfficePhoneAllowed
Controls.Description: Determines whether voice call is usable on office phone numbers. Mobile phone calls are always allowed.

Controls.Name: includeTargets
Controls.Description: Object Id or scope of users which will be able to use Voice call.

Controls.Name: includeTargetsRegistrationRequired
Controls.Description: Determines whether the user is enforced to register the authentication method.

Controls.Name: excludeTargets
Controls.Description: Object Id or scope of users which will be excluded to use Voice call.

Description: Define configuration settings and users or groups that are enabled to use text messages for authentication.

Controls.Name: state
Controls.Description: Whether the Voice call is enabled in the tenant.

Controls.Name: includeTargets
Controls.Description: Object Id or scope of users which will be able to use Voice call.

Controls.Name: includeTargetsRegistrationRequired
Controls.Description: Determines whether the user is enforced to register the authentication method.

Controls.Name: excludeTargets
Controls.Description: Object Id or scope of users which will be excluded to use Voice call.

Controls.Name: includeTargets.isUsableForSignIn
Controls.Description: Determines if users can use this authentication method to sign in to Azure AD. If setting is set to true, users can use this method for primary authentication.

Description: Define configuration settings and users or groups that are enabled to use certificate-based authentication.

Controls.Name: state
Controls.Description: Whether the CBA is enabled in the tenant.

Controls.Name: includeTargets
Controls.Description: Object Id or scope of users which will be able to use CBA.

Controls.Name: includeTargetsRegistrationRequired
Controls.Description: Determines whether the user is enforced to register the authentication method.

Controls.Name: excludeTargets
Controls.Description: Object Id or scope of users which will be excluded to use CBA.

Controls.Name: authenticationModeConfiguration.x509CertificateAuthenticationDefaultMode
Controls.Description: Select the default protection level for all certificate bindings. The default binding will ensure the certificates bind to the selected protection strength setting unless special rules are applied. To override the default, create special rules.

Controls.Name: authenticationModeConfiguration.rules
Controls.Description: Rules are configured in addition to the authentication mode to bind a specific x509CertificateRuleType to an x509CertificateAuthenticationMode.

Controls.Name: certificateUserBindings
Controls.Description: Defines the fields in the X.509 certificate that map to attributes of the Azure AD user object in order to bind the certificate to the user account.

Description: Define specific combinations of authentication methods and metadata. The authentication strength policy, when applied to a given scenario using Azure AD Conditional Access, defines which authentication methods must be used to authenticate in that scenarios.
Tenant-wide application authentication method policy to enforce app management restrictions for all applications and service principals.
Restrictions on app management operations for specific applications and service principals.

Represents the policy for enabling or disabling the Azure AD admin consent workflow. The admin consent workflow allows users to request access for apps that they wish to use and that require admin authorization before users can use the apps to access organizational data.

Controls.Name: isEnabled
Controls.DisplayName: Users can request admin consent to apps they are unable to consent to
Controls.Description: Defines if admin consent request feature is enabled or disabled

Controls.Name: notifyReviewers
Controls.DisplayName: Reviewers will receive email notifications for requests
Controls.Description: Specifies whether reviewers will receive notifications

Controls.Name: notifyReviewers
Controls.DisplayName: Reviewers will receive email notifications when admin consent requests are about to expire
Controls.Description: Specifies whether reviewers will receive reminder emails

Controls.Name: requestDurationInDays
Controls.Description: Specifies the duration the request is active before it automatically expires if no decision is applied

Controls.Name: reviewers
Controls.Description: The list of reviewers for the admin consent

Controls.Name: version
Controls.Description: Specifies the version of this policy. When the policy is updated, this version is updated

Description: Describes the conditions under which permissions can be granted (for example, during application consent)
Represents the base policy in the directory for cross-tenant access settings
Represents the policy to specify the characteristics of SAML tokens issued by Azure AD
Represents a policy that can control the lifetime of a JWT access token, an ID token or a SAML 1.1/2.0 token issued by Azure Active Directory (Azure AD)
